qas.question: How long must an Alaskan have lived in the state in order to receive a Permanent Fund Dividend?
What percentage of the Permanent Fund is divided betwen Alaska's eligible residents?
When did disembursements from the Permanent Fund begin?
How much was the initial disembursement from the Permanent Fund?
How long must an Canadian have lived in the state in order to receive a Permanent Fund Dividend?
What percentage of the Permanent Fund is divided betwen Alaska's ineligible residents?
When did disembursements from the Permanent Fund end?
When didn't disembursements from the Permanent Fund begin?
How much was the final disembursement from the Permanent Fund?

context: Starting in <a2_0><b6_0>1982<b6_0/><a2_0/>, dividends from the fund's annual growth have been paid out each year to eligible Alaskans, ranging from an initial <a3_0><b8_0>$1,000<b8_0/><a3_0/> in <b7_0>1982<b7_0/> (equal to three years' payout, as the distribution of payments was held up in a lawsuit over the distribution scheme) to $3,269 in 2008 (which included a one-time $1,200 "Resource Rebate"). Every year, the state legislature takes out 8% from the earnings, puts 3% back into the principal for inflation proofing, and the remaining <a1_0><b5_0>5%<b5_0/><a1_0/> is distributed to all qualifying Alaskans. To qualify for the Permanent Fund Dividend, one must have lived in the state for a <a0_0><b4_0>minimum of 12 months<b4_0/><a0_0/>, maintain constant residency subject to allowable absences, and not be subject to court judgments or criminal convictions which fall under various disqualifying classifications or may subject the payment amount to civil garnishment.
